description.p: 1- Your hair grows 6 inches longer at the start of each day. If you don’t have hair, you grow it. Your hair is supernaturally tough and can only be cut using a magic blade by a creature that succeeds on a Strength check against your Curse DC.

element.name: CURSE: Your hair grows 6 inches longer at the start of each day. If you don’t have hair, you grow it. Your hair is supernaturally tough and can only be cut using a magic blade by a creature that succeeds on a Strength check against your Curse DC.

description.p: 2- Bright sparkles and rainbows appear whenever you make an attack or cast a spell. Also, cheerful birds and little forest animals dance and sing around you at inconvenient and inappropriate times

element.name: CURSE: Bright sparkles and rainbows appear whenever you make an attack or cast a spell. Also, cheerful birds and little forest animals dance and sing around you at inconvenient and inappropriate times

description.p: 3- Your body generates a magnetic field of unpredictable strength. When you are within 30 feet of an object no larger than a 5-foot cube that is made either partly or entirely of metal, the GM can ask you to make a Charisma saving throw against your Curse save DC. On a failure, the object is pulled 30 feet toward you and sticks to your body. A stuck object can only be removed with a DC 15 Strength check.

element.name: CURSE: Your body generates a magnetic field of unpredictable strength. When you are within 30 feet of an object no larger than a 5-foot cube that is made either partly or entirely of metal, the GM can ask you to make a Charisma saving throw against your Curse save DC. On a failure, the object is pulled 30 feet toward you and sticks to your body. A stuck object can only be removed with a DC 15 Strength check.

description.p: 4- Each morning, your appearance and voice change to that of a random humanoid, though all your game statistics remain the same. You can’t be affected by illusion magic that disguises your appearance, such as disguise self

element.name: CURSE: Each morning, your appearance and voice change to that of a random humanoid, though all your game statistics remain the same. You can’t be affected by illusion magic that disguises your appearance, such as disguise self

description.p: 5- Your presence attracts creatures such as rats, flies, crows, or other beasts of ill omen. These creatures can be driven away with a successful Animals Handling check against your Curse DC. The creatures always return within 1d4 hours.

element.name: CURSE: Your presence attracts creatures such as rats, flies, crows, or other beasts of ill omen. These creatures can be driven away with a successful Animals Handling check against your Curse DC. The creatures always return within 1d4 hours.

description.p: 6- You can only spend hit dice or recover from exhaustion by resting while submerged in water. You still gain any other benefits of completing a rest while not submerged.

element.name: CURSE: You can only spend hit dice or recover from exhaustion by resting while submerged in water. You still gain any other benefits of completing a rest while not submerged.

description.p: 7- The top of your head becomes an oversized mushroom cap. You can’t wear or benefit from helmets, hoods, hats, or other such items, as they won’t fit over the mushroom cap. You can still wear headbands, as well as lenses or other items that fit over your eyes

element.name: CURSE: The top of your head becomes an oversized mushroom cap. You can’t wear or benefit from helmets, hoods, hats, or other such items, as they won’t fit over the mushroom cap. You can still wear headbands, as well as lenses or other items that fit over your eyes

description.p: 8- Every time you kill another creature, you must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Curse DC. On a failure, the slain creature haunts you, becoming a spirit that only you can see. These spirits follow you wherever you go but don’t harm you directly.

element.name: CURSE: Every time you kill another creature, you must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Curse DC. On a failure, the slain creature haunts you, becoming a spirit that only you can see. These spirits follow you wherever you go but don’t harm you directly.

description.p: 9- Your bad luck is costly. Whenever you fail an ability check, 1d4 x 10 gp in your possession turns to lead.

element.name: CURSE: Your bad luck is costly. Whenever you fail an ability check, 1d4 x 10 gp in your possession turns to lead.

description.p: 10- Your luck is now bound to a lucky charm, which is a Tiny nonmagical object on your person at the time you become cursed. If you don’t have this object on your person or if it is destroyed, you have disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws until you spend 8 hours holding onto another Tiny item to make it your new lucky charm.

11- Once per day, you are subject to the effect of the confusion spell at a time determined by the GM. The spell only targets you, and you can resist the effect by succeeding on a Wisdom save against the spell, which uses your Curse DC.

element.name: CURSE: Once per day, you are subject to the effect of the confusion spell at a time determined by the GM. The spell only targets you, and you can resist the effect by succeeding on a Wisdom save against the spell, which uses your Curse DC.

description.p: 12- Your cursed tongue gets you into trouble. In combat, you must insult an enemy creature on each of your turns. The insulted creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your Curse DC or be compelled to target you on its next turn. If a creature succeeds on its saving throw, it is immune to your curse’s effect for the next 24 hours

element.name: CURSE: Your cursed tongue gets you into trouble. In combat, you must insult an enemy creature on each of your turns. The insulted creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your Curse DC or be compelled to target you on its next turn. If a creature succeeds on its saving throw, it is immune to your curse’s effect for the next 24 hours

description.p: 13- Once per day, at a time determined by the GM, you are targeted by a polymorph spell, using your Curse DC as the spell save DC. On a failure, you are transformed into a Tiny beast chosen by the GM.

element.name: CURSE: Once per day, at a time determined by the GM, you are targeted by a polymorph spell, using your Curse DC as the spell save DC. On a failure, you are transformed into a Tiny beast chosen by the GM.

description.p: 14- When you drink a potion, you must make a Constitution saving throw against your Curse DC. On a failure, you gain none of the potion’s effects and are poisoned for 1d4 rounds.

element.name: CURSE: When you drink a potion, you must make a Constitution saving throw against your Curse DC. On a failure, you gain none of the potion’s effects and are poisoned for 1d4 rounds.

description.p: 15- You cannot see your reflection on any reflective surface, but your image is reflected on all non-reflective surfaces. You have disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

element.name: CURSE: You cannot see your reflection on any reflective surface, but your image is reflected on all non-reflective surfaces. You have disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

description.p: 16- You are cursed with otherworldly insight. Once per day, at the GM’s discretion, you must make a Wisdom (Insight) check against your Curse DC. On a success, nothing happens. On a failure, you receive a disorienting vision of things, past, present, or future, and have disadvantage on all Intelligence and Wisdom checks until you complete a long rest.

element.name: CURSE: You are cursed with otherworldly insight. Once per day, at the GM’s discretion, you must make a Wisdom (Insight) check against your Curse DC. On a success, nothing happens. On a failure, you receive a disorienting vision of things, past, present, or future, and have disadvantage on all Intelligence and Wisdom checks until you complete a long rest.

description.p: 17- Your body becomes cheese. Animals such as rats are frequently drawn toward you, and all creatures have advantage on Perception checks made using smell to detect your location.

element.name: CURSE: Your body becomes cheese. Animals such as rats are frequently drawn toward you, and all creatures have advantage on Perception checks made using smell to detect your location.

description.p: 18- Every item you craft with your tools, as well as any equipment you wear, carry, or wield for more than 1 hour, takes on an eerie or sinister appearance. Good and neutral aligned NPCs tend to be suspicious of you.

element.name: CURSE: Every item you craft with your tools, as well as any equipment you wear, carry, or wield for more than 1 hour, takes on an eerie or sinister appearance. Good and neutral aligned NPCs tend to be suspicious of you.

description.p: 19- You can’t be touched by or become submerged in water or other liquids as if you are permanently affected by the water walk spell.

element.name: CURSE: You can’t be touched by or become submerged in water or other liquids as if you are permanently affected by the water walk spell.

description.p: 20- A strange sigil appears on your tongue that makes it hard for you to lie. Whenever you attempt to deceive, the GM can ask you to make a Charisma saving throw against your Curse DC. On a failure, you blurt out the truth you were trying to conceal.

element.name: CURSE: A strange sigil appears on your tongue that makes it hard for you to lie. Whenever you attempt to deceive, the GM can ask you to make a Charisma saving throw against your Curse DC. On a failure, you blurt out the truth you were trying to conceal.

description.p: 21- You gain a sensitivity to sunlight. You have disadvantage on attack rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

element.name: CURSE: You gain a sensitivity to sunlight. You have disadvantage on attack rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

description.p: 22- You become cursed with bad luck. Whenever you use a gaming set or make an Acrobatics, Animal Handling, or Sleight of Hand check, you must succeed on a Charisma saving throw against your Curse DC or have disadvantage on the check.

element.name: CURSE: You become cursed with bad luck. Whenever you use a gaming set or make an Acrobatics, Animal Handling, or Sleight of Hand check, you must succeed on a Charisma saving throw against your Curse DC or have disadvantage on the check.

description.p: 23- You are cursed never to carry a tune and automatically fail any Charisma (Performance) check based on music. If you are a bard, you can still use music to cast your spells, but it always sounds terrible.

element.name: CURSE: You are cursed never to carry a tune and automatically fail any Charisma (Performance) check based on music. If you are a bard, you can still use music to cast your spells, but it always sounds terrible.

description.p: 24- Your teeth turn to metal. You can no longer digest normal food, but you can survive by eating at least 1 pound of Tiny nonmagical objects made of metal, such as coins, per day.

element.name: CURSE: Your teeth turn to metal. You can no longer digest normal food, but you can survive by eating at least 1 pound of Tiny nonmagical objects made of metal, such as coins, per day.

description.p: 25- A black owl follows you at a distance of 15 feet at all times. At night it whispers dark prophecies that only you can hear. The owl cannot be harmed or driven away by any means.
100- Super cursed! Roll twice on this table and apply both curses. Curses can stack on you, and you can gain additional curses while cursed.
